intro: Neoporteria hankeana, commonly known as the Hanke's neoporteria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
